title: Lesson 18
paragraph: Time and numbers help organise daily life and plans. Calendars, clocks and schedules mark seasons, years and moments. Understanding words about time makes it easier to set appointments, keep timetables and manage routines.

words.meaning: the length of time a person has lived or something has existed
words.example: Her age is twenty-two.

words.meaning: happening once every year
words.example: The annual festival attracts many visitors.

words.meaning: a scheduled meeting or time with someone
words.japaneseMeaning: 予約、アポイントメント
words.example: I have a dentist appointment at three.

words.meaning: a period of one hundred years
words.example: The building is nearly a century old.

words.meaning: a device that shows the time
words.example: Look at the clock to see the time.

words.meaning: happening every day
words.example: He writes in his diary daily.

words.meaning: a period of ten years
words.example: Technology has changed a lot this decade.

words.meaning: to make something happen later than planned
words.example: The train had a short delay.

words.meaning: a personal record of daily events and thoughts
words.example: She writes in her diary before bed.

words.meaning: showing time in numbers rather than hands
words.example: Check the digital clock for an exact time.

words.meaning: before the expected or usual time
words.example: Arrive early to get good seats.

words.meaning: the period of the day between late afternoon and night
words.example: We went for a walk in the evening.

words.meaning: the time that is yet to come
words.example: Plan for a better future.

words.meaning: one of two equal parts of something
words.example: She ate half the cake.

words.meaning: a unit of time equal to sixty minutes
words.example: The meeting lasted one hour.

words.meaning: after the expected or planned time
words.example: Sorry I'm late for class.

words.meaning: 12 o'clock at night
words.example: The train arrived at midnight.

words.meaning: a unit of time equal to sixty seconds
words.example: Wait a minute, please.

words.meaning: a very short period of time
words.japaneseMeaning: 瞬間、ちょっとした時間
words.example: Just a moment while I check.

words.meaning: happening once a month
words.example: We pay rent monthly.

words.meaning: at the present time
words.example: Nowadays people use smartphones everywhere.

words.meaning: the time before now
words.example: Learn from the past.

words.meaning: the time that is happening now
words.example: Be present and focus on your task.

words.meaning: one of four equal parts; 15 minutes of an hour
words.example: The show starts in a quarter of an hour.

words.meaning: a plan showing times for events or tasks
words.example: Check the schedule before you go.

words.meaning: one of the four periods of the year with distinct weather
words.example: Spring is my favourite season.

words.meaning: a unit of time equal to one-sixtieth of a minute
words.example: She finished the race in 30 seconds.

words.meaning: a schedule listing times of events or transport
words.example: Check the train timetable for departure times.

words.meaning: the present day
words.example: What are your plans for today?

words.meaning: the day after today
words.example: I'll see you tomorrow at school.

words.meaning: the evening or night of today
words.example: Let's watch a movie tonight.

words.meaning: happening once a week
words.example: They hold a weekly meeting on Mondays.

words.meaning: any day of the week except Saturday and Sunday
words.example: I work on weekdays but rest on weekends.

words.meaning: Saturday and Sunday; the end of the week
words.example: We plan trips on the weekend.

words.meaning: the day before today
words.example: Yesterday it rained all day.

words.meaning: happening once a year
words.example: They attend a yearly conference.

words.meaning: a system for organising days and months of the year
words.example: Mark the date on your calendar.

words.meaning: a distinct period of history
words.example: The digital era changed communication.

words.meaning: one hundred years old
words.example: The century-old building was renovated.

words.meaning: the duration of a person's life or something's useful life
words.example: He made a lifetime of contributions to science.
